pricing: Series A-1: 5.88% (Tax-Exempt), Series A-2: 5.50% (Tax-Exempt), Series B: 8.00% (Tax-Exempt)
maturity: Series A-1: 18 years (2042), Series A-2: 4 years (2027), Series B: 18 years (2042)
security_package: Fee-simple mortgage, assignment of rents & leases, security agreement, pledge of GP equity interests, FF&E. Held by Truist Bank (Trustee) under Trust Indenture with first-priority mortgage. Collateral valued at USD 44.3 million (CBRE Appraisal).
guarantees: Construction completion guarantee by KCG Companies and principals
Debt service guarantee until stabilization (1.15x DSCR or Dec 2027)
Stabilization shortfall guarantee (bond redemption at par to maintain 1.15x DSCR)
project_description: 175-unit, 3-building, low-income multifamily affordable housing development with community building on 13.1-acre site in Capitol Heights, Maryland (Washington D.C. metro area). Project includes units restricted to 5%, 40%, and 60% AMI caps. Construction timeline: ~27 months + 4 months fill-up to stabilization by December 2027. 10 units reserved for unhoused & foster youth (FYI initiative). Property managed by Habitat America, constructed by Commercial Group (MD).
description: Tax-exempt affordable-housing bond investment (USD 41.42M total across three series) secured by fee-simple mortgage and LIHTC regulatory agreements. ORIX serves as sole bondholder for senior secured bonds issued by Housing Authority of Prince George's County (HAPGC). Borrower: KCG SSP Capitol Heights LP. Developer/Sponsor: KCG Companies LLC. Series breakdown: A-1 ($33.6M, 18yr, 5.88%), A-2 ($5.17M, 4yr, 5.50%), Series B subordinate ($2.65M, 18yr, 8.00%). Purchase price at par (100). Expected life ~4 years. Series A-1 includes 5-year IO period then amortization. Call protection: A-1 has 10-year no-call with make-whole thereafter; A-2 callable anytime; B has 7-year 103 call down to par (year 10). IRRs: A-1=8.07% (9.59% TEY), A-2=5.50% YTM (6.96% TEY), B=8.00% YTM (10.13% TEY). Exit options include Freddie Mac M/ML securitization (90-92.5% leverage) or secondary bond sale.
notes: Risk Screening Date: 11 Oct 2024. Expected stabilization: December 2027. Non-rated bonds. LIHTC equity investor: Truist Community Capital (USD 23M). Bridge lender: Truist Bank (USD 14M LIHTC Bridge Loan). Subordinate lender: Prince George's County Dept of Housing & Community Development. Legal counsel: Ballard Spahr (Freddie Mac experience). WorldCheck/LexisNexis compliance completed - no issues. No conflicts of interest. Borrower structure: SPE PropCo (wholly owned LP with KCG GP and TCC LP). ESG Score: 3.4/5.
key_risks:
1. Construction delays or cost overruns - 27-month construction timeline with potential for delays
2. Post-construction stabilization risk - 4-month fill-up period to achieve 1.15x DSCR
3. AMI or rent fluctuation risk - tenant rents restricted by Area Median Income caps (5%, 40%, 60% AMI)
4. Limited support for integrated units - FYI/HOME-ARP program units (10 units for unhoused/foster youth)
5. Market vacancy risk - though current area vacancy rate is low (~4%)
6. Interest rate risk - tax-exempt bonds in rising rate environment
7. LIHTC compliance risk - regulatory requirements and restrictions
mitigants:
1. GMP (Guaranteed Maximum Price) contract with $2,500/day liquidated damages for delays
2. Multiple guarantees: construction completion, DSCR maintenance (1.15x), and stabilization shortfall guarantees by KCG Companies and principals (corporate and warm-body guarantees)
3. Low LTC ratios: 61% at close, 53% post-LIHTC equity redemption
4. Strong local demand with low vacancy rate (~4% in Capitol Heights/Prince George's County area)
5. Freddie Mac securitization option for exit (90-92.5% leverage with B-Tranche retention)
6. High collateral value: USD 44.3M appraised value (CBRE) vs. USD 41.42M total bonds
7. First-priority mortgage held by experienced trustee (Truist Bank)
8. Experienced property manager (Habitat America) and general contractor (Commercial Group MD)
9. Spread of 275 bps over MMD benchmark provides cushion
10. Secondary bond sale option available as alternative exit

deal_name: Talimarjan Combined Cycle Gas Turbine (CCGT) Power Plant
security_package:
Investors have committed $240 million in the development of the power plant and have assumed $700 million in existing debt.

Equity acquisition / Privatisation. Mubadala and TAQA jointly acquire 80% controlling interest.

UZS 257,999.86m (USD 19.97m) – Cash equity provided by sponsors. (50/50)
project_description: The Talimarjan Combined Cycle Gas Turbine (CCGT) Power Plant, located in the Kashkadarya region, is one of Uzbekistan’s largest thermal power facilities with an installed capacity of about 1.7 GW. The plant comprises two operational 450 MW units and two additional CCGT units under construction, supported by international lenders including ADB and JBIC. In May 2025, Mubadala Investment Company and TAQA (Abu Dhabi National Energy Company) acquired an 80 % stake in the plant’s operations and maintenance company, marking Uzbekistan’s first large-scale thermal power privatisation.
description: 80% acquired by Mubadala Investment Company and Abu Dhabi National Energy Company (TAQA) 40% each; remaining 20% retained by the Uzbek side (JSC Talimarjan TPP / Ministry of Energy).
notes: Talimarjan Power Plant (TPP) – a combined-cycle gas turbine (CCGT) facility in the Kashkadarya region, operated by JSC Talimarjan TPP.
mitigants: None disclosed; no sovereign guarantee identified. The project’s revenues are supported by the long-term PPA with Uzenergosotish.
